sen.j: 蓮教（れんきょう、宝徳3年（1451年） － 明応元年5月2日 (旧暦)（1492年5月27日））は、戦国時代 (日本)の浄土真宗（真宗興正寺派）の僧。
sen.e: Renkyo (born 1451, died May 2, 1492 (old lunar calender) (May 27, 1492) was a priest of the Shin-Buddhism Sect (the Koshoji school of the Shin-Buddhism Sect) in the age of civil war (Japan).

Renkyo (1451 - July 5, 1492) was a priest of Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) (the Koshoji School of Jodo Shinshu Sect) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states) (Japan).

sen.e: His father was Shozen of Bukko-ji Temple, an adopted child of Chikanaga KANROJI.

sen.j: 妙法院の教覚に師事して佛光寺を継ぐが、父性善がなくなると本願寺蓮如に近づいた。
sen.e: He studied under Kyokaku of Myoho-in Temple and succeeded to Bukko-ji Temple, and later inclined to Rennyo of Hongan-ji Temple after his father died.

sen.j: 1481年（文明 (日本)13年）、宗派内の内紛から佛光寺を出て蓮如の門下となり、経豪から蓮敎と名を改めた。
sen.e: After leaving Bukko-ji Temple as result of an internal conflict within the school in 1481, he became a pupil of Rennyo and changed his name from Kyogo to Renkyo.

sen.j: 蓮如の孫にあたる恵光尼を妻とし、山科興正寺を興隆してその基礎を築いた。
sen.e: He married to Keikoni, a granddaughter of Rennyo, and led Yamashina Komyo-ji Temple to prosper by establishing its foundation.
